page.title: 10HEALTH SERVICES _ PART TWO
page.content:
THE COTTAGE HOSPITAL, STANMORE The hospital is funded by the Jewish Society for the Mentally Handicapped. It is actually a home for 14 people who would find it difficult to fend for themselves. It can take up to 25 people in all. There are 15 staff whose aim is to help their patients to gain confidence and independence. They also help to find homes and support those who can manage on their own with outside assistance.
ORME LODGE, STANMORE Orme Lodge is funded by Harrow Area Health Authority. It is a geriatric unit catering for about 20 long-stay patients and 65 day-patients per week. There are 8 staff. There are 5 small wards, 2 therapy rooms, 2 activity areas and a lounge.
